results.title: England vs Australia 1958-59 1st Test
results.brief_description: Highlights of the first test in the 1958-59 series, of England vs Australia, played in Brisbane and featuring captains Brian May and Richie Benaud.

results.title: England to Australia in under nine days
results.brief_description: A Fox-Movietone newsreel (vol. 3, ep. 19) from 1932 documenting the arrival of Charles Scott, the first person to fly from England to Australia in under nine days - as the title suggests. He lands in Sydney and is greeted by Sir Charles Kingsford Smith and welcoming crowd. Similar events in Brisbane are also shown.

results.title: England Made Me
results.creator_credit: Jack Levin, Atlantic Productions and Peter Duffell
results.brief_description: Anthony Jarrant (Michael York) is a young, good looking Englishman whose had it easy all his life. Kate (Hildegard Neil), his sister, is more successful than him. She is secretary and lover to a ruthless German financier (Peter Finch) who arranges a job in Germany for Anthony. Anthony discovers that what he sees in the Germany of 1935 is not what he believes in - a discovery that inevitably leads to his downfall. Based on the novel by Graham Greene.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Levin, Atlantic Productions and Peter Duffell

results.title: England in the Middle Ages
results.creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films, Education Foundation for Visual Arts and David Boulton
results.brief_description: An overview of four hundred years of British history. Deals with the impact of the Norman Invasion; the Doomsday Book; the structure of medieval society; the importance of religion, castles, cathedrals and abbeys; the development of towns and trade; the Magna Carta; the Crusades; the beginnings of parliament; the Black Death; the decline of the fuedal system; the Peasant Revolt; the rise of the university and the Hundred Years War.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Boulton-Hawker Films, Education Foundation for Visual Arts and David Boulton

results.title: England-Australia on kerosene: Vicker's Viscount is amazing aircraft
results.brief_description: Cinesound Review No. 1198 newsreel. The story of the first Vickers Viscount aircraft bought in England for Trans Australia Airlines. The flight to Australia from London was made at 22,000 feet via Rome, Athens, Beirut, Karachi, Delhi, Singapore, Darwin and Melbourne and completed in an hour less than two days flying time.

results.title: England's wealth from wool
results.creator_credit: Basic Films and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: Illustrates the extent of sheep farming in Britain in the early Middle Ages, from the beginning of the export trade in wool through to the Industrial Revolution and the gradual introduction of machine methods into the wool industry.

results.title: England's Shakespeare
results.brief_description: A study of Stratford-on-Avon, the birthplace of William Shakespeare, the greatest English dramatist. This town is now the site of the Shakespeare Memorial Theatre, a place of interest to students and tourists from all over the world.

results.title: Enginemen
results.creator_credit: BFI, Unit Five Seven and Michael Grigsby
results.brief_description: An outstanding documentary offering an impression of engine at locomotive sheds on the outskirts of Manchester, filmed during the early hours of a wintry morning. There is very little commentary other than the men themselves commenting on the changes being brought about in their lives by extensive dieselisation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: BFI, Unit Five Seven and Michael Grigsby

results.title: Engineering: flue gas analysis (Orsat apparatus)
results.creator_credit: Audio Productions and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: Setting up the Orsat gas analyzer; drawing in an air-free sample of flue gas; absorbing and measuring the amounts of carbon dioxide, oxygen and carbon monoxide in the sample; and how to calculate the amount of nitrogen.
